intro: Laubertia brasiliensis, commonly known as the Brazilian sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Brazil. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming during the dry season. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Laubertia brasiliensis plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing nectar for pollinators in its native habitat.
